my initial plan was to come on here and complain about how much my life isn't going the way i've wanted it to go, and how i'm not happy because i haven't had a boyfriend ever(!) and that i have just been down because rejection can be just too much to handle when everything else is too much. its just so much more than what i let on. iam so ready for a peaceful life .then i read justine's post and i lost my train of thought, and i cried. more like sobbed. i sobbed on the way home from michael's too. sure, life sucks, but, its those friends who fill your heart with the hope to carry on one more day, and its those friends who encourage you when you feel like you can't go on because your heart has been broken in pieces. i am so ready to be loved, and to love somebody. i love god, and believe me, i know hes enough. but i have waited an incredible amount of time for someone to come along. i have to tell myself, even i dont want to, maybe there is someone out there for me. geez. someday. so, i'm gonna work on my patience. pray that i don't lose hope and i focus on god, who is in control of my life, whether i see it or don't see it due to my ignorance.

justine. you are amazing yourself. your gift of encouragement and discernment gets me everytime. you amaze me with your love of god, and the faith you show with your beautiful heart. i cant wait to see what god is going to do in your life. and i'll be home to see it. :)

okay, yesterday was so emotionally charged. i drove home from sb, and i convinced michael to hang out with me instaed of going to work. so he went tanning or whatever, and then he wanted to go get his check from hollister. no biggie right? wrong. i was wearing this skimpy tanktop without a bra on, and i didn't want to go in to the mall with out a sweatshirt. so i borrowed a sweatshirt, and i ended up looking like crap. i HATED the way i looked. i had no makeup on, and i was so digusted. as we were leaving the mall, i started to cry cause i was so mad at myself for leaving and going out like this. and i felt bad, because mike didn't know what to do, and i don't think he understood why i was crying. but its okay, cause everyone needs a good cry. i'm feeling nauseous   right now. bleh..

last night at church was so much fun. it was the pumpkin toss, where you throw a pumpkin from the second story, on to a trapoline and try to make it to a trash can. it was so funny, except that holvin freakin' almost hit me in the face with his huge carving of his and brian's faces. it was really funny. we all then played this massive dodgeball game in the gym. i got decked in the face by john(too bad i might like him:/) but it was worth it.

eh. i'm so tired. tired of everything. tired of friends, tired of school, tired of cramps. tired of boys. tired of death. i just want everything to be normal, and i want my life to be peaceful. it seems i'm always fighting with someone, or missing a class, or daydreaming. i've prayed for peace for so long, and i thought that coming to sb would promote that inside. it didn't. i have learned that friends will learn not to care, boys will be even worse, and family is always there for you. it seems that no one ever talks about their family anymore. my family is huge, and we always have each others backs, so i know i have unconditional love from them when it seems that i won't get it from other things. i feel like crap. ah! i have choir to look forward too. thats always fun when the door is open, cause otherwise its a freakin' sauna in there, and i can't sing like that. i'm just going to let things not stand in my way.

i just woke up from the most amazing dream. i drempt that in my dream, i was at a memorial service for some extended family member, and i met one of my cousins friends who was as close to being family as you could get. we were at my busia's house, and just all hanging out waiting for this service which was the next day. and i re-met this guy, because evidently, we had a past, and i guess we hooked up or something like that. and i remember that at my busia's house, we just sat and talked for hours and hours about the deepest stuff. i felt so close. it was awesome. i still couldn't remember his name either. i think it was alex, ryan or mike, something with four letters. so, the next day, the service was at el torito (don't ask), and about 200 of my closest family was there, and i sat next to him. but, half way through the service, my cell phone started going off, and i wasn't able to turn it off, and everyone started looking around to see who's it was, and people knew it was mine. five minutes passed by, when all of a sudden, another phone in my purse went off, and it looked like my laptop. i started to cry, and it was weird. but, thats not the amazing part. the amazing part, is that alex, mike or ryan, the whole time was sitting there, holding my hand, rubbing my shoulders, wiping my tears off and telling me how amazing iam. it was so great. i really didn't want it to end, but joelle called. it seriously seemed SO real. but then i thought about it. i do have that, because god treats me like that. and someday, maybe, i will have that. i will have that guy to hold my hand and guide me when i lose confidence in myself, or to rub my back after a long day at work. i can't wait for that. then i was wondering if i know him now, or will he be revealed later. i can't wait, but i don't want to hope. i just want him to revealed now, so he can help me through things, so he can love me for who i am. i want to be the best girlfriend/wife/friend/lover/counselor that this man has ever encountered. it may sound cheesy, but i guess a dream can change your outlook on love and hoping that hey, maybe, i might get a shot at love. 
someday, the man my dreams will come along (literally)

I can't get over how awesome our Mexico trip was. Each hour, I think of new things that made the trip that much more worth while. since Erin commented in my journal about some memories, I will make a composite list of everything she listed and I remember.
 
.Luis--the hottest Mexican on the face of the planet. Erin, Justine and I have claimed him, so he is no one elses. beware.
 
.THE BEAST--okay. in our work project, we had to dig a straight trench. Except, for there was this rock about three feet wide hanging out in our way. So it took us an hour to dig the homie out of its spot, and then we got it out.
 
.the panda--the bathroom was a panda building. One bathroom for 30 girls. Enough said.
 
.all in favor voting (which, might I add, is NOT a democracy.)--so we were all laying in our tent, and I wouldn't shut up, and kept making jokes, when Brittany said all in favor of Courtney shutting up say 'I,' and three people said it, which funny, but then to make it funnier, someone from another tent said it, which was the funniest thing ever.
 
.the cross--Scott and Jesse and the rest of the adult leaders talked at this cross on the hillside. It was freezing, and it was up a hill. so, once again, enough said.

MEXICO WAS INCREDIBLE.
 
I'm going to TRY to recap everything that happened. I had such an amazing time. I didn't know that God could work in so many different ways. When we first got there I was so pumped, but Jeff and Adam kept pissing me off, and Scott was being sarcastic in his little ways. So it didn't seem that optimistic. But then John and I had a talk at dinner about how he has been through hard things, and it was really cool to be able to talk to him. After that, we had a campfire and the kids talked about the day. I went to bed, and then woke up FREEZING!  The sleeping bag that Erin let me borrow broke and I had no zipper. The next day we started on our construction, and our team had to build this massive trench down a hill. I then got sent over to try to get this wire out of the ground, after Scott of course broke a pipe. I, then was hauling about fifty pounds of rocks up a hill in to a pile. The same thing pretty much happened the next day, except Wednesday night we laughed so hard together in our cabin about the most ridiculous things. I also rested from that massive hike that we went on. It was a blast though. Friday was the beach day, and the night that I had to share my testimony to the whole group. That was probably the funniest/weird day ever. We went to this park that smelled like poo. Justine, Kaitlynn and Brian and I went to this GHETTO soccer/dirt field. This nino kicked the ball up, and Brian and I went for it, and I got knocked in the head and I guess I had a minor concussion. It didn't help anymore because the day before, I was heading 50 yard (in the air) boots by Scott in the cabesa. It was just outrageous. Courtney and I had a great conversation on the beach. So did Kyle and I. He is so amazing. He kept me sane, because I was going insane the whole trip, and I all I did was vent to him. He had really insightful and great things to say to me the whole trip, along with his testimony. I was pretty nervous when I had to get up there to share. Plus I was cold, so it didn't make for the best of circumstances. Today was also an amazing day. We just talked about things and I worked things out with people. It was awesome. Okay. I'm waay too tired to go on anymore. If you want to know more, just ask me. It was simply amazing. Everyone needs to experience life in a different way.
